qas.question: What group do the Shia tariqahs belong to?
What has happened to some of the Shia tariqahs last Imams?
Who deny the concept of Occulation?
What kind of Imam do Shia Nizari Ismailis have?
What would happen to the Nizari Ismaili if the Imam fails to leave a successor?

context: Although all these different Shia tariqahs belong to the <a0_0>Shia<a0_0/> group (as opposed to the Sunni group) in Islam, there are major doctrinal differences between the main Shia tariqahs. After that there is the complete doctrinal break between all the different Shia tariqahs whose last Imams have gone into <a1_0>Occultation<a1_0/> and the <a2_0>Shia Nizari Ismailis<a2_0/> who deny the very concept of Occultation. The Shia Nizari Ismailis by definition have to have a <a3_0>present and living<a3_0/> Imam until the end of time.[citation needed] Thus if any living Nizari Ismaili Imam fails to leave behind a successor after him then the Nizari Ismailism’s cardinal principle would be broken and it’s very raison d'être would <a4_0>come to an end<a4_0/>.
